In 2017, we set up the second FSTP in Leh, which has been customised for the unique climatic and geographic characteristics of that region. We have set up around 400 wastewater treatment systems. We have prepared city sanitation plans for several cities in India - Shimla, Kochi, Raipur, Varanasi etc. Our capacity building arm, CASS, has been recognised as a KRC for MoDWSS

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Sea snakes are a species rich (~70 species) group of marine reptiles found throughout the tropics (excluding the Atlantic). These animals are frequently caught in fishing nets as bycatch, especially in trawlers. These encounters can be deadly for the snake and sometimes for the fisherman. Our study is looking at the effects of fishing practices on sea snake populations and their ecology in the Sindhudurg district of Maharashtra

detailsOfAchievement: SUMMER CAMP CHILDREN IN NATURE With the support of volunteers from Avani a children camp on environment and life skills during summer holidays of 2012 in Vagamon, Kerala. 20 girls and boys enjoyed learning through creative activities, yoga and nature walks. They identified different species of birds, insects and plants. They also visited Tea factory and learned about cultivation, production process. CLIMATE CHANGE RESPONSIBILITY CHILDREN AND YOUTH EFSA organized students from Bangalore in the age group of 13 to 14 years on climate change and responsibility of children and youth in March 2015. URBAN DEVELOPMENT AND POVERTY ALLEVIATION, AWARENESS, EDUCATION, TRAININGS PROGRAMS EFSA has conducted various environmental awareness programs with the support of volunteers in Government schools and citizen groups in Bangalore to enrich them with awareness of need of healthy living, solid waste management, health, hygiene, sanitation, rain water harvesting. CHILDREN FOR TOMORROW HEALTH, HYGIENE AND SANITATION The project promoted by EFSA in alliance with the ING Vysya Foundation, the social action arm of the ING Vysya Bank between 2015 and 16, targeted the children of either sex of Std. I to V of the Government Lower Primary School at Saraipalya of Thanisandra ward in Bangalore South Zone together with their respective families and communities with the purpose of getting them groomed into healthy citizenry with desirable practices of health, hygiene and sanitation. Students educators on HHS have been formed to bring about behavioral change among the children, in the families and in their communities. Mothers committees have been formed in the localities to practice and promote health, hygiene, food and nutrition security, girl child education, gender equality and environmental sanitation. Toilets and infrastructure for hand wash has been constructed in the school. JOB ORIENTED SKILL TRAININGS In collaboration with Life Dream Foundation, a 3 months free course on career development Skill Training was organized for the benefit of for 28 unemployed young men and women in Thanisandra from March to June 2014. The course focused on retail sales management, improvement of English, computer, interpersonal communication, ethics and responsibility and environmental awareness. All trainees were employed in the retail companies with remunerations ranging from Rs.7000 to 9500 per month. Women Empowerment in Bangalore Slums, 50 marginalized women in Thanisandra were provided with skill training by a social entrepreneur in making greeting cards to augment their supplementary income and participate in the economic activities of their families. RURAL DEVELOPMENT AND POVERTY ALLIEVATION EFSA has been involved in empowering poor women in a cluster of about 20 rural villages in Bangalore, with its epicenter at Melena Nayakarandahalli, Kelagina Nayakarandahalli Villages in Tubagere Hobli through awareness, education and trainings. SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOOD PROMOTION Goat rearing was chosen by women as a subsidiary income generation activity and an estimated 100 poor women will be benefitted in one village in the first phase. Food and Nutrition Security through nutrition gardens and organic farming is in pipeline. Promotion of culture of responsibilities in all activities and among the citizens in general.

title: FAMESWAVALAMBANA
detailsOfAchievement: The Foundation for Action Motivation and Empowerment was founded in the year 2001 by Smt. Jamuna Raghavan and Sri.N.S.Raghavan [co-founder Infosys] to serve in the area of Neuro Developmental disabilities. At FAME we offer multidisciplinary services- Physiotherapy, Speech therapy, Occupational therapy, psychological counseling, Psychiatric services, Medico social work and special education. We are now one of the best institutions for people with special needs. We train them in Functional academics and vocational skills so that we are able to accomplish our mission - â€œto optimize their potential and help them lead a life of dignity and self respect.â€ F.A.M.E. Swavalambana (An initiative of F.A.M.E. India) works with a vision to nurture the abilities of the differently abled and empower them . At FAME India the training, based on Individualized Educational Programme (IEP) prepares the child/individual in functional and pre-vocational skills. They are then ready to move into an open job placement or a sheltered work unit. FAME Swavalambana is one such sheltered work unit- an initiative of FAME India and was set up in 2009.It acts as an employment platform for the trained adults from FAME India and outside. Close to 60 persons with special needs are with us now, trained in skills that help them to earn a livelihood. We have seen remarkable changes in their state of mind due to the economic empowerment. The feeling of being a contributing member in the family elevates their self - esteem. Our mission is to create an environment that is conducive for the differently abled individuals and support them to work effectively. We have taken a step ahead now to extend services by starting a new project in collaboration with Apna Haat - a group from Delhi.
